name: physostegia angustifolia
description: Narrow-leaved Obedient Plant is rhizomatous - a fairly fast-spreading underground root system. It has a lighter flower color and earlier bloom time than Obedient Plant.Â  If you like genus Physostegia, it's nice to have both of these in a planting.  Dormant bare root plants ship each year during optimal transplanting season: Fall (October) or Spring (April/May).
features: Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
Recommended for home landscaping but potentially aggressive; could overwhelm small landscapes
